summary.p: Is healthy and hopes to hear the same from Bullinger. A war is feared. Plans to come to Zurich at Easter, but will not stay long, instead intends to go on a journey again. Greetings.

div.p: Grace and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.

Dear sir and cousin, I want to let you know that I am fresh and healthy. Hearing the same from you would be a great joy for me. Dear cousin, I want to let you know that things are still well with us, though there is concern about a war. May God avert it according to His will.

I also plan to be with you after Easter, God willing. Therefore, I will not write much. I also do not intend to stay long in Zurich, as two companions will travel with me. With them, I intend to journey again, as it is not for me to remain in Zurich.
No more for now, may God be with us all. Amen. Greet your wife and my guardian for me.
Written on St. Matthias' Day at night in the year 1534.
From me, Jörg Stadler, always your willing servant.
To the honorable and well-learned Master Heinrich Bullinger, preacher at the Grossmünster in Zurich, by hand.
